title: Didone
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131225212750/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20131225212750/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Didone**

Didone-style letterforms encompass the "Modern," or neoclassical style of typefaces, which originated in France, Germany, and Italy around 1800. The predominate players in the movement were [Giambattista Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20131225212750/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Giambattista%20Bodoni) and the member of the [Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20131225212750/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Didot) family.

**Style name explanation**  
Didot + Bodoni = Didone
author: dan_reynolds
